dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: ...I mean, it's a huge step for Europe, obviously, and for, like, their economy.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: ...I mean, it's a huge step for Europe, obviously, and for, like, their economy.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Huge step? Uh, it's reckless, A. Completely reckless.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Huge step? Uh, it's reckless, A. Completely reckless.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Reckless? They've made progress! Only a thousand new cases, um, compared to six thousand at their peak.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Reckless? They've made progress! Only a thousand new cases, um, compared to six thousand at their peak.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: only 1,000 new COVID-19 cases are being reported daily, compared to 6,000 at the peak of the outbreak in March, according to the Washington Post.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: But the EU, right, they recommend keeping external borders closed until June fifteenth! Italy's just ignoring that.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: But the E U, right, they recommend keeping external borders closed until June fifteenth! Italy's just ignoring that.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: the EU recommends external borders remain closed to foreign nationals until at least June 15.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, but tourism is, like, thirteen percent of their entire GDP, B. They have to open.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, but tourism is, like, thirteen percent of their entire G D P, B. They have to open.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: 13%. Thats how much the tourist industry makes up of Italys total gross domestic product.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: And open to everyone? The announcement didn't even specify if it's just the EU or not, officially.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And open to everyone? The announcement didn't even specify if it's just the E U or not, officially.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The announcement did not specify whether the measure only applies to travelers from the European Union

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: The Italian Embassy in D.C. confirmed, uh, Americans and non-EU tourists will be warmly welcomed on June third. It's clear.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: The Italian Embassy in D.C. confirmed, uh, Americans and non-E U tourists will be warmly welcomed on June third. It's clear.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The Italian Embassy in Washington D.C. did not immediately respond to questions from Forbes asking whether Americans or tourists from outside the EU will be allowed to travel to Italy on June 3.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Warmly welcomed into a potential second wave, maybe! Hotels operating at eighty percent capacity, it's too much, too soon.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Warmly welcomed into a potential second wave, maybe! Hotels operating at eighty percent capacity, it's too much, too soon.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: No, businesses are following social distancing, disinfecting. Bars, shops, all opening. They're ready.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: No, businesses are following social distancing, disinfecting. Bars, shops, all opening. They're ready.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Bars, restaurants, shops, hairdressers and religious services will be able to open on Monday, while all other economic activity will be allowed to resume on June 3, provided businesses follow social distancing and disinfecting guidelines.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Ready for what? To undo all that progress? The Baltic states opened to each other, not, like, the whole world.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Ready for what? To undo all that progress? The Baltic states opened to each other, not, like, the whole world.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The Baltic countries of Estonia, Latvia and Lithuania too are reopening borders to one another.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Germany's opening with France and Austria, that's a travel bubble. Italy's just going bigger.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Germany's opening with France and Austria, that's a travel bubble. Italy's just going bigger.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Germany, for example, opening its borders with France, Austria and Switzerland on June 15, creating a sort of travel bubble for the summer months.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: But that's internal EU travel! This is international. The U.S. State Department just adjusted their advisory to "caution."
dialogue_turns.tts_text: But that's internal E U travel! This is international. The U.S. State Department just adjusted their advisory to caution.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The U.S. State Department still advises citizens to avoid all international travel.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, "caution," not "don't go." It's, uh, a step towards normalcy, B. A necessary one.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, caution, not don't go. It's, uh, a step towards normalcy, B. A necessary one.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The U.S. State Department still advises citizens to avoid all international travel.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Normalcy at what cost? I just, like, don't think they've considered the broader implications for public health.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Normalcy at what cost? I just, like, don't think they've considered the broader implications for public health.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: The implications are, uh, their economy surviving. They went through a lot, they need this.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: The implications are, uh, their economy surviving. They went through a lot, they need this.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: And they might go through it again if they rush things like this, honestly. It's too fast.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And they might go through it again if they rush things like this, honestly. It's too fast.
